text:
We stayed at Bali Breakers for 6 nights for our honeymoon and the place was faultless! Perfect if you want to get away from the noise and busy feel of Kuta/Seminyak - this resort is slightly isolated but easy enough to get to Jimbaran or other places in Bali if you organise a driver. 

The villas are impeccable and the private pools are a luxury! Perfect for romantic getaways. The main pools are also lovely with lounges and drinks service. Never felt too busy or loud or crowded. 

Food and drinks are likewise amazing with a focus on Balinese/Indonesian food and western food. Themed dinners are also a great idea with Italian, BBQ and Indonesian the ones we tried. 

Try the spa too! Affordable and professional service, we left feeling so relaxed! They offer a range of services and the ladies are very skilled. 

They have a cute combi golf cart that can run you down to Balangan Beach (not great for swimming but good for surfing) and they will stop at the grocery store on the way there/back. 

This resort is a well-kept secret in the Jimbaran area. We would love to return because most of all, all the staff are friendly and warm and very caring about your stay.

Thank you for an amazing honeymoon! 😊
title: Perfection 😊

text:
We have spent three days in the resort and most of our time is in the private pool and the swimming pools. As a new resort (only opened for half year), the room and facilities are exceptionally clean. A tiny problem is that the hot water supply is not enough during 7pm to 10pm, which makes the bathing not comfortable. 

Each room is equipped with a private pool and a jacuzzi bath tub. There’s three swimming pools and I strongly recommended the one near the spa which is less busy. There’s floating bed which you can use for free. 

The spa is good, but it’s too full and need prior appointment. We went to book the spa right after check-in but there’s no time slot for couple within the next three days.

Lunch and dinner is good too, it serves high quality Indonesia food and western style food and the price is not expensive. We also join the BBQ dinner on Tuesday which is quite satisfying. However, the breakfast is a bit upsetting as the choice is limited and the taste is not that good.

A reminder is that this resort is quite isolated and needed quite some time to travel to other tourist spot (the only closest tourist spot is the Uluwatu temple which takes around 25 mins). But it’s an ideal resort if you wish to relax and stay inside the resort whole day.
title: Ideal Isolated Garden for Relax

text:
We stayed at Cross Bali Breakers for a week and would recommend it to anyone travelling to Bali!

Overall the hotel is amazing, but the staff are really the highlight of the stay. They are friendly, helpful and very personable. They go above and beyond to help in anyway they can, and even remembered my name throughout the trip. They even kindly shuttled us to the nearby convenience store to get snacks outside of the times of the usual shuttle to the beach. We would really like to extend our wholehearted thanks to everyone that works there. 

We stayed in the two bedroom villa which was spacious, clean and included the usual bathroom amenities but also footwear, eye masks and ear plugs. The extra pillow menu is a lovely touch, with staff kindly delivering the pillows straight away. We liked that the rooms are supplied with safe mineral water via reusable glass bottles instead of plastic. The pool in the villa was a great temperature, and we enjoyed using the small shelf in the pool that the sun beds lie on. 

The grounds are beautiful and are kept meticulously. They gave us a tour of the grounds on arrival, and explained the daily activities provided at the hotel including aquarobics, HIIT and pilates. They even offer paid cooking classes at the restaurant, which we found informative, fun and had a lot of food to eat after. The main pools are gorgeous, well kept and a nice temperature. 

The hotel is situated in a quieter area of Jimbaran, half an hour from the airport and approximately an hour South of Seminyak. This has the added benefit of the area being quiet; however, made adventuring out the hotel a bit more difficult. The local taxi drivers sit near the entrance to the hotel and are not supportive of Gojek or Grab, Bali's version of a rideshare app, and their rates tend to be 2-3x that of the apps. This meant that the Grab drivers would not accept rides if we placed Cross Bali Breakers as the direct hotel pickup; however, if we placed the pick up at Cafe La Pasion at the end of the driveway we had no issues getting a car. The hotel staff in the lobby also very kindly offered to drop up at the end of the driveway with the buggy, but it is only a 2-3 minute walk. 

Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again.
title: Amazing stay at Cross Bali Breakers

text:
Amazing!

Short story - best service, best food, best activities, best everything, highly recommend a stay at Cross Bali Breakers. 

Long story (very long sorry) – My wife and I spent 7 glorious days in this wonderful resort. From the moment you arrive you are treated like royalty. From the check in process through to the guided tour of the resort facilities via the golf buggy, it is the greatest start to your well-earned holiday you could ask for. Even before we arrived, I had a thousand questions about the accommodation that they happily and quickly answered. 

The Villa – We stayed in a one-bedroom villa (710) which was perfect for us. Pool was lovely and just the right temp to cool you off after a big day in the Bali sun. The bed was super comfy and yes, they have a pillow menu (see pic) so you can change up your pillow to your preference, but ours were perfect. At first, we thought the AC was a bit underpowered but to be honest it was just right unless you prefer your Bali Villa to be like a fridge. The shower was amazing with as much hot water as you like, and I know this might sound silly, but the toilet had the paper roll holder where you could actually reach it without having to perform a yoga moves. The daily banana and beetroot snacks were a nice touch. We loved the easy drip coffee pouches they provide each day (we got some from the local supermarket to take home). The ‘I’m on vacation’ robes were very cool and turn down service each night was a nice touch. If housekeeping ever requested to enter while in the villa they would always double check for permission before entering and each following employee would do the same. We had an issue with our safe and it was changed out in a matter of minutes. Maybe the only minor feedback we could find for improvement was the lighting over bathroom mirror for my wife to do makeup. Although there appeared to be adequate lights they were just not ideally situated over the mirror. I still give the Villa 10 out of 10. PS some might find the Villa Pool a little cool as they are shaded for part of the day but as mentioned I liked this temp for cool off and refer to main pool review if you like your pool temp a bit warmer. 

The resort Pools – we spent most of our swim time in the main pool adjacent restaurant. 5 out of the 7 days it felt like we were the only ones in the resort. We had our pick of where to sit, where to swim and never any pool lounge reserving with towels going on. Even at 60-70% Villa capacity it was not until days 6 and 7 that we started to see a few more faces emerge, it was like our own giant private villa with poolside service. The water temp is perfect for afternoon/evening cocktails and just floating around on the water beanbags or in pool lounges, so good! We did not swim in the top pool, but it looks stunning. I used the lap pool near the gym a few times after training in the gym and that was fantastic!

The activities/facilities – We had some excellent sessions with the HIT and Yoga coaches over several mornings. No need to book, you can just rock up and it’s no additional charge. Most mornings it was just my wife and I so it was almost like PT sessions. The SPA was lovely but make sure you let the ladies know what pressure you like as they had me on the ropes a few times, but I love the pain. We also did a cooking class which was wonderful. We had a cook, chef and a trainee all in with us and you guessed it (just the two of us again). The food we produced was amazing but was enough to feed a family of 4 so time this right if you participate, suggest start around 10-11 so its lunch or 4-5 so its dinner (we were somewhere in the middle). We even had the GM pop in during our cook to see how things were going, this place really is special.

The meals – Simply out of this world. We did not have a food item/meal that was not 5-star worthy. Not only was breakfast a huge variety of buffet selection to suit any taste there was also a specials menu that changed each day that was included as part of our breakfast (the French toast is a must, best I have ever tasted). We also were informed that if something was not on the menu that we could request it and providing they had the ingredients they would provide. 3 times a week they had theme night dinners with live music ($30 all you can eat or only $10 if you had dinner vouchers). If you did have dinner vouchers that entitled you to 3 courses and again all spectacular dishes (we eventually got through them all). Our first theme night (Italian) was accompanied by one of the best local entertainers I have come across in Bali. Playing covers in his own unique sound we could not leave until he finished his set, such an awesome night (Cross Bali Breakers keep this entertainer on your rotation list he was amazing Sunday 12th March). 

Location – Important to note that this location is out of the way, tucked in the much less busy streets of Jimbaran with just a few locals and surfers buzzing by the main road to Balangan but I think that’s what gives this place its charm. I still love Kuta, Legian and Seminyak but it was nice to see a different part of the island and if you have a scooter like we did or utilise the hotel shuttle service beautiful beaches are only 5-10 minutes away. 

The staff – Amazing and I wish I could remember everyone’s name (as they all remembered ours) but I am sure I will miss some names so just a massive thankyou for your warm smiles and greetings every day and the best hospitality I have ever experienced. One manager spoke to us at breakfast and said Cross Bali Breakers is now our Bali home and we are welcome back there anytime to use the facilities as we like, did I mention this place is special.

Our package – for those that like a few extras check out Luxury Escape or Scoopon for prices and inclusions. Our room included free flow cocktail hour every night, free lunch or dinner every day and single spa treatment for 2. It would be fair to say we did not miss too many cocktail hours and we used every one of our meal vouchers so have a look at what’s on offer before you book. 

Some tips – No the local drivers are not supportive of GoJek or Grab so if you wish to find alternative transport arrange another local driver or make the rideshare pickup point down the road a bit, I am sure the resort shuttle would even drop you there if requested. This is not unusual in the more remote areas of Bali and until time passes, I prefer to respect the locals wishes. Nice little beach club at Balangan beach (MAZU) get 10% off if you mention staying in Cross Bali Breakers. Small supermarket and money exchange not too far from the resort towards the beach, I think the shuttle service will run you there on request. 

Thankyou Cross Bali Breakers for an awesome stay.
title: Amazing!

text:
We had a great 9 night stay at Cross Bali Breakers. It was out first trip overseas with our 7month old so we wanted something very relaxed and easy going.

The staff go above and beyond everyday. Everyone says hello & everyone is always looking to offer help (wrangling a baby this was so well received by us). Our daughter seemed to be the star of the show everyday and it was so nice to see other people love her as much as we do.

We stayed in the one bedroom Villa and it was much bigger than I expected. The Villa pool was fabulous and so were all the other pools/facilities on site.

The reason I’m not giving 5 stars is because:

1. We arrived quite late at night and were told the room and cot was ready to go. This was music to our ears after a long day of travelling with a baby. When we got in the room there was no cot. They set it up straight away but it was just a nuisance given how tired we were.

2. Im not sure the hotel can do much about this but the “local taxis” at the front of the driveway really annoyed me. They price gauged simple trips and then turned grab/go Jek cars away (that were ordered by phone) if they tried to come in and pick us up. I have no issue using local taxis but they should probably rethink their pricing and not charge 3-5 times the price of the available
Apps. We got around this by walking to the end of the driveway and still getting our grab or go jek but it was annoying having to do that with a baby so I’d recommend the hotel trying to find a solution to this.

3. Food and drink is expensive for the area and for Bali in general. It is what it is due to the remote location but just something to note.

4. I wouldn’t stay 9 nights again. I noticed after I already booked that lots of people split their trips in Bali between two-three places. I’d do this in the future as the hotel is in a very remote location and it takes a long time to get anywhere.
title: Great spot for a quiet relaxing getaway

text: We just had five nights as part of a Travelzoo package.  We have been lucky to have been coming to Bali for 37 years and honestly this has been our favourite place. The staff really made it special from our first meeting with Hendrick, the Duty Manager to Sari, Juli, Teyun in the restaurant and all the other staff members that I don’t know their all their names. Special mention must go to Bayu who is the gym instructor. He was very knowledgeable, patient and really wants his clients to do well. We both utilised his services (which are free), every day which was a bonus. Each staff member was attentive, friendly, kind and went out of their way to make your day special. They all genuinely want you to have a memorable stay.  My husband had a special birthday celebration and they surprised him with a beautiful room set up and birthday cake. The breakfast was delicious and very fresh with lots of options and daily specials. They even serve sparkling wine and mimosas if you’re that way inclined. We were! The floating breakfast was an experience in itself. Plentiful, fresh and very novel. We moved on to Legian today and wish we were back in the quiet surrounds of Cross Bali breakers. So much more peaceful and chilled. Thank you to all the staff there for making us want to come back for more! Your boutique hotel deserves to have success. Thank you again.

We stayed for a week with a 2 bedroom villa. The staff were all so friendly and helpful! You can even get a free ride to the nearby beach or the beach club! The staff even offered to drive us down to the local cafe when we mentioned it! Not to mention that they also allowed us to have a late check out no charge since our flight was at 9pm which was such a great help!

Another high light was the floating breakfast which was so beautifully arranged and tasted good too. The breakfast buffet was also delicious with different specials every day, as well as special dinners such as the grilled seafood buffet or the Italian buffet with live music almost every day.

If you are looking for a quiet place to relax during your stay in Bali, this is definitely the place!
title: Relaxing stay!

For a peaceful, relaxing Bali holiday in Jimbaran, you must visit Cross Bali Breakers Resort. We can’t wait to go back again ❤️

text:
We had a wonderful honeymoon at Cross Bali Breakers. The service was impeccable and since check in we were greeted with such amazing service. It was a warm evening so they gave us an iced pole too cool down and took us to our villa with a buggy car. The food at the restaurant was really delicious and the breakfast buffet options were scrumptious which catered for both western and Asian tastes. 

The private villas were luxurious with very high quality bedding and pillows. We really enjoyed the privacy of the villas and when we checked in - it was so thoughtful to decorate the bedroom with swan flowers and rose petals in the bathroom - great way to start our honeymoon! We also opted for a floating breakfast for one of the days - amazing! 

We took part in 3 fitness classes that was offered free at the hotel - yoga, HIIT and Pilates. Bayu the gym attendant was very professional and kept us fit during our stay! He spoke excellent English and was patient with us given we hadn’t exercised in a while - one of the highlights of staying at the hotel! He deserves a raise!

It was CNY when we stayed at the hotel so there were Lunar New Year celebrations including a lion dance on New Year’s Eve when we were there which was a nice surprise.  

Would highly recommend anyone looking for a relaxing getaway away from the hustle and bustle.
title: Amazing stay at Cross Bali Breakers! Highly recommend.

text:
First time coming to Bali we didn’t really know what to expect but this resort absolutely blew our minds. It is further from all the craziness of Kuta and Legian but it made it just that bit more relaxing. On arrival we were given little icy poles, taken to our room by golf cart and given a tour of our room. We were also given a free 60 minute couples massage and lunch/dinner voucher which we definitely made sure to use! 
The staff were the nicest people we’ve ever met, always saying hello as we walked past and always looking after our needs. The staff who cleaned the rooms were super lovely and did an incredible job, always leaving little towel animals on our bed which was so cute. Oka and Jaya (I think his name was) were very helpful with shuttling us to the nearby supermarket to get supplies and use the ATM instead of us walking along to road to get there. Juli in the restaurant was so amazing, even helped me organise a cake for my partners birthday that said happy birthday and got the band to sing to him. Very thankful to her for organising that for us! 
The rooms here are also absolutely gorgeous, the beds are the most comfortable beds I’ve ever slept on whilst being away and the sheets are soooo soft it had me looking for the tag to figure out where they were from [very sad I can’t buy them :( ] 
We used one of the taxi drivers from the hotel called Anom, he was always checking in with us every morning to see what plans we had for the day; the most sweet and lovely taxi driver I’ve ever come across! We even gave him a tip at the end of our stay because we were very happy with his services, we have definitely recommended him to our family and will keep his number for next time. 
Overall we were extremely sad to leave and wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy more of what the resort has to offer.
title: AN ABSOLUTE MUST!

text:
We recently stayed at the Cross Bali Breakers resort and cannot recommend it more highly.  The resort is located in a secluded quiet part of Jimbaran near Ugusan.

The staff were exceptional they made us feel so comfortable.  They were always very happy, helpful and so friendly.  Yuli at reception welcomed us with open arms and assisted us throughout our stay.  Oka was our “local” tour guide and took us to Dreamland Beach and Balangan Beach lookout where we were able to take some lovely photos (all free of charge using the resorts private shuttle service).

We had a private one bedroom pool villa which was just beautiful.  The room was spacious and clean, it had everything that you might require for a trip away. 

The breakfast was a standout with a large and varied selection to choose from.  The same applies to lunch and dinner with different food theme nights featured. There was often live music also.

On our trip many people chose to stay in their villa, but we preferred to utilise the facilities, three terrific pools and the dining area in particular.

This truly was a home away from home.

Special thanks to Hendrik who assisted us with all our needs, he was extremely attentive and hospitable. Honourable mentions must go to Ming, Juli, Suci, Sari, Dita, Jaya, Tuyen and I am probably leaving out others who were just as helpful.

We enjoyed our time there so much we have booked to go back in May 2023!
title: Cross Bali Breakers

text:
We have just returned from 7 days at Cross Bali Breakers and wish we could've stayed longer. Amazing villas, awesome pool/communal areas, fantastic tranquil location close to surf but far enough away from the hustle of main tourist areas, and wonderful friendly staff!

We arrived late on a Sunday evening after amenities were closed, but we were greeted with sandwiches in our villa, and a delightful arrangement on the beds. 

It was the little things with the staff - making sure they knew our names and remembered how we have our coffee, or our favourite cocktail, that really made it feel like a home away from home. Every driver we had was engaging and friendly, and most spoke reasonable, if not excellent English. Everyone from the concierge to the gardeners would make an effort to say hello if you were nearby.

Accommodation is in private villas, which are surrounded by high walled gardens that offer complete privacy and security. The beds were incredible, and you step out of your bedroom into your private plunge pool, which the kids loved first thing in the morning as we were always awake pretty early before the communal areas were open.

The included buffet breakfast was delicious, which offered some western options but mostly Indonesian fare which was well worth it. The daily specials and the a la carte options were equally delicious. The quality of the lunch and dinner options was outstanding - I can certainly recommend the seafood buffet and the Indonesian buffet. You're paying hotel prices, so more expensive than other local options, but still excellent value when coming from Australia. Though I also recommend taking a walk or drive to explore local warungs nearby, or further afield within 5-15 minutes.

We would definitely stay again. Amazing!

text:
If you want a true 5 star experience, I’d recommend to look else where. It does pain me to write this review because everyone was extremely nice and just so lovely. All in all we did have an “ok” time however it just wasn’t 5 stars.

Pros

- Staff are relatively friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much to ask and they were always cheerful.
- The bed was very comfortable - high thread count and used slumberland mattresses.
- The buffet breakfast was pretty decent and quite good value at only 180k++ per person. Staff were also very accommodating and no complaints there. However options were limited.
- The main pool bar and pool are great places to relax and just enjoy life. The chilled house music is also great
- Overall experience was okay
- The WhatsApp chat to talk to reception was very useful
- We had dinner there and it was rather excellent

Cons

- Arrived to dirty chairs and bean bags in the villa. This is BASIC hotel standards and doesn’t require a hotel to have 5 stars. However the fact I’m paying a premium price should mean that the hotel is extra vigilant. Completely unacceptable.
- Even though the hotel is fairly new a lot of the metal surfaces such as doors, shampoo dispenser and shower area have already oxidised resulting in a green layer on a lot of the items. This can be easily prevented and removed with the correct cleaning policy.
- The hotel colludes with the local taxis which is an utter disgrace. We wanted to get a taxi from our hotel to the seaside. The hotel said we shouldn’t use grab/gojek/bluebird and to book a local taxi through them. That’s all well and good if they wouldn’t charge x4 the price of the standard rate. This made me extremely annoyed.
- When you arrive you have to sign a contract which is normal when staying at a hotel, however what’s different about this contract is that at the bottom in fine print, it states that the hotel will automatically charge you 100k per food or drink item you bring into the resort!?! This wasn’t enforced though to be fair
- The wrong name had been written on the welcome card in the villa. Also the light for the villa number was also not working.  Little details like this are not super important but shows the lack of attention to details that the resort policy enforces.
- Some plug sockets were not working in the villa. In the end, there was only 1 in the entire villa working.
- There were quite a lot of bugs around. Obviously you’d expect some being in nature but think the hotel could do more to ensure they’re non in the villa when you first arrive. A lot of the villa doors have large gaps in them as well which makes it hard to control.
- The rain shower pressure was abysmal
- Messy and incomplete paint jobs around the resort which leaves a “don’t care and can’t be bothered attitude”.
- Some Pool Towels have stains on them which is gross.
- The float in the main pool smells so bad. Probably never been cleaned and had drinks spilled on it.
- The “pool bar” is not really a pool bar because it has no staff. You can sit there but to order you need to go to the main bar.

I’ve stayed in many 5 star resorts all over the world and in Bali. All in all I would advise against staying here if you’re expecting 5 star quality. It’s far from it and I’d even find it hard to justify it being a 4 star resort. I think a previous reviewer summed it up very well. There’s only so far politeness can go to make up for other hotel defects. I appreciate Covid has been difficult for all businesses the past few years however it’s disappointing when you’ve booked a holiday you’re looking forward too and it’s not what you expected
title: A 3 star hotel

text:
Overall:
Loved this resort and would highly recommend it –The contemporary, architecturally designed, surf inspired hotel pulls out all the stops and is a great place to go if you want some peace and quiet relaxation, or go down surfing/to the beaches. Demographic was varied with lots of couples, a few families and friends travelling together with a mixed age group when we were there.

Pros:
- Contemporary style villas with high walls for complete privacy 
- Everything is pristinely clean and the private plunge pools are lovely with the seating area/table and chairs, then at the other end small beanbags for laying on the deck
- all the doors slide open from the bedroom and the bathroom, onto the pool and deck area
– Great air con in the bedroom
– The staff cannot do enough for you and are happy to help with anything. Standouts were Henrik and Julee
– there is a free shuttle buggy which takes you down to the beach. We asked if they would mind taking us down to watch the sunset – this was outside of the routine shuttle service, but they were more than happy to do that for us and wait 
– the beds are extremely comfortable and pillows were also very good. They have a pillow menu as well
– the food is really nice, a mix of western and Balinese food
– the communal restaurant/swimming pool area is beautifully designed with lots of seating options
– there is a wedding chapel, situated up high overlooking one of the three communal pools
- The overall feel of the resort is one of fantastic relaxation

Cons:
– The music played at the restaurant at night can penetrate into the villas a bit. 
- If there was a wedding on, would probably want to be in a villa on the other side of the complex as it is close to one group of villas and may carry noise? But this is just an observation
title: Definitely recommend – Private plunge pools, contemporary villas with high walls, fantastic staff

The rooms are fantastic. They were very clean, comfortable beds, big bathrooms with a private pool which was so great. 
The food and drinks here are great quality and well presented. Nothing was too hard for the kitchen and bar staff everyone went above and beyond to make sure you were always happy with everything. 

The massages are amazing the staff at the spa were very professional, made us feel comfortable and we always felt so relaxed when we left. 

We are so happy we stayed here for our anniversary and would definitely come back. This is one of the best places we have stayed in Bali and highly recommended it to anyone.

text:
Cross Bali Breakers is a great hotel for a short getaway. My partner and I stayed here a week in a beautiful villa with private pool and really enjoyed the solitude. We predominantly used it as a base for taking day trips to visit temples, rice terraces and the like in Ubud and Uluwatu, but also enjoyed a lazy day or two by the pool and in the spa. 
Fair warning, it’s a little out of the way, so expect to drive at least an hour to get anywhere. The service was brilliant - it was a joy to see Eddie each night as he refilled our water. All in all, a really enjoyable stay!
title: A great hotel for an easy week

text:
This resort is an oasis of peace and tranquility. Tucked away from all the hustle and bustle in what feels like its own secluded valley, we could not have chosen a more perfect place to start our holiday.

The resort is not huge, but that only adds to the atmosphere. We had a bungalow with a little plunge pool, and it was utterly private. The bedroom looked straight out onto the pool, and the wood panelled design gave it a sublimely cosy feel - the bed is one of the most comfortable that I have had in any hotel.

There are three pools, and the main one in the centre has a pool bar and a couple of giant floating beanbags; drifting across the pool on these was like being in heaven. The restaurant is situated next to this pool, and the food was gorgeous. 

Lastly, but most importantly, the staff were all extraordinary. They learnt our names on day one, and could not have been more lovely. The level of service is second to none, and everyone, from the gardeners to the hotel manager, greeted us with a smile and constant enthusiasm. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you wany somewhere closer to the airport than Ubud, but not in the noisier hubs like Seminyak.
title: A True Gem

text:
X2 (Cross Bali Breakers) is an all villa resort, contemporary, raw designed pool villa in Jimbaran area near to Belangan Beach. 

The villa is really value for money, as the villa is spacious comes with indoor and outdoor area. There is a plunge pool though it is not huge, good enough to soak and have fun. 

The bathroom is spacious, with a huge tub overlooking the outdoor area, free standing shower, WC and a big vanity Sink. 

Outdoor space comes with a coffee table with chairs, bean bags and a plunge pool in the middle. Plants and shrubs add some tropical feel within the 4 walls villa. 

The resort provides shuttle service to a nearby minimart where you can stock up some fresh fruits, drinks, daily necessities and snacks. They also provide shuttle to the Belangan Beach. 

There are 3 swimming pools in the resort. Absolutely stunning and generous in my opinion. First, there is an infinity pool at the Reception area, a main pool with a swim up bar and an adult pool near the X2 Spa and X-Fit Fitness Corner. 

The Service is very good, they always greet and put on a smile, even the gardeners, kudos to them. 

Meal is the biggest disappointment. The breakfast spread is limited, breads are stale, hot food are not hot and only 5 hot food items apart from egg/pancake cooking station. You are going to have troubles if you stay here for more than a week. 

In my opinion, more options should be given, eg, Hash Brown, Baked Beans, Pasta, Porridge, Soup, Sautéed Mushrooms etc. It is not difficult at all. Some signature Balinese or Indonesian breakfast could be introduced as well. 

Overall, it is a nice resort, highly recommended.
title: All 5 Star Except the Breakfast

text:
Amazing little gem of a hotel. 

Room was great, walking into a patio area and onto the private pool, then through a separate door into the room. Big comfy bed and a huge bathroom. Housekeeping team were great, with the added extra of a turndown service which included fresh towels, our son enjoyed the towel art left by them! 

Food was incredible, everything we had tasted amazing. We had the floating breakfast on our last morning there which was a great experience. 

We didn’t use the pools as we went out each day of our stay, or used the pool in our villa, but it looked nice with the option to sit in cabanas or on bean bags. 

My husband and I each had a massage which was very good, we wanted to go back for more treatments but ran out of time. 

The staff are all so lovely and helpful, especially Julie and Oka. Julie was so kind and Oka was always on hand to take us to the supermarket in the buggy or down to the beach, telling us about the area and taking photographs,  the buggy was a great extra. It was also nice to have the option to communicate with the hotel via whatssap, all queries were answered quickly. 

Thank you for a great stay! We hope to return on our next visit to Bali 😃
title: Amazing hotel!

text:
We had a great  stay in a one bedroom villa at X2 while the resort was still pretty quiet. Great service throughout, staff very friendly and accommodating. 
Room was lovely, spacious - great to have the extra area with a place to sit and have a cup of tea etc. Could do with a few hooks somewhere to hang up towels or clothes and a full length mirror. 
Resort itself is beautiful, great pool area and lovely setting.

Unfortunately a few minor "let downs": one of the reasons we booked was the advertised gym. Equipment and facilities at the gym were pretty basic and it felt like the whole area could do with a bit of TLC - also it's fully outdoors. 

The restaurant seems overpriced for what you get. One day we ordered juices by the pool and what we got was a cordial or came from a packet and it cost 35k. I understand prices are more expensive than at a shack on the beach, but every beach shack on Balangan Beach down the road offers FRESH juices for a much better price. 

Overall would definitely recommend this place, but suggest you eat outside, apart from ordering fries to the room which were tasty :-)
title: Fabulous 1 month stay

text:
VISIT: beginning of March 2020
STAFF, RESORT, FOOD, PRICE, CLEANLINESS, SPA: more than 5 stars

I cannot express how happy I am to have found X2 and their resorts. After this stay, my husband and I have made it a goal to visit a few more of their X2 resorts. I found this resort as a deal on Luxury Escapes but they were sold out for the week we would be in town, so I booked directly through their site. 

RESORT: The resort itself is beautiful with so many views, I think we took pictures every day of the same spots. We arrived when it was pouring rain and still found it beautiful. There are plenty of pools to choose from, including your own room's pool. I will say the ONE uncomfortable part was the bathroom was pretty HOT. The AC unit is in the bedroom, which is great, but cooling down the bathroom, at the time we went, was nearly impossible.

PRICE: For the 3-4 days that we stayed here we spent probably cheaper than we would for the same amount of time in Hawaii, including the food. We are at an advantage being from the US and the exchange rate from US to IDR. 

STAFF: The staff was SO welcoming and all of them new our names. Any recommendations we had or any questions we had, they were more than willing to accommodate. On the way to the Beach Bar that the shuttle takes you, they were so nice and willing to stop at an ATM on the way, so we could grab some IDR as we had no cash in Bali. One night, we had a great talk with the general manager and after meeting him, I realize why his staff are as dedicated and jovial as they are. What a fantastic atmosphere. Usually, my husband and I are not one to stay at the resort the entire time, but here it was amazing. 

FOOD: the food was delicious as you can see from all my insane amount of pictures. PLENTY of seafood to choose from, which I love but so many others. My husband and I both enjoyed a different meal each day/and each meal and were never disappointed. I wasn't sure about the marketed "floating breakfast" but this was absolutely delicious and such a neat experience for us (see my photos)

SPA: the spa was so amazing we booked TWO spa treatments in 3-4 days and was truly relaxing. For Bali you will see SO many advertisements for massages and spas and there were plenty of cheaper ones off of the resort, but the price was reasonable and fantastic service

PAYMENT: We were easily able to charge everything to the room and paid with credit card by the end of our stay, no problem. We barely needed cash in Bali

BEACH BAR: This resort paired up with a local beach bar, Lucky Wins, which was AMAZING. The shuttle will take you there for free and you get a discount, when you mention you are staying at X2. This was a FANTASTIC day and we're so sad we couldn't go back. They have lounge chairs/couches with turf that overlooks their pool and then the beach (see my photos). They have a great menu with drinks and good food, what a fantastic place to relax! 

I cannot be certain that we will be back to this resort specifically, but honestly, we probably will. We DEFINITELY will return to X2 resorts and its all thanks to this staff and this wonderful stay here.
title: FANTASTIC Stay, Staff and Food | Our new Favorite Resort

text:
This hotel was the perfect hotel to stay during the pandemic outbreak as we were able to be confined to our 2 room villa comfortably without much contact with anyone else. Villa had plenty of space for sun, pool, and excellent wifi. Kids can play within the villa while parents can keep an eye on them. Refillable essentials- shampoo, hair conditioner and shower gels. Rooms were not connected though... it is designed in a way u have to go outdoors to walk to the other room. So if it rains- you will get wet trying to get to the other room within the villa.

Room service  choice was limited after Day 4... there's only so much you can eat repeatedly. But this applies to all hotels after day 4 but in saying that - food here was good.

Cons
This hotel is far from everything.  Closest beach is the Balangan beach which was rocky & muddy. Hotel provides Free Shuttle. Please check timing  as they left us there and forgot to pick us up. We do not recommend the beach as the beach is full of rocks, dog poop, and dirty water. My kids cut their foot on the rocks. Do wear wet shoes to be safe.

Pros
Staff is super accommodating, friendly and treat you like family. So many staff to mention but kids will always remember Rory from the pool bar as he makes milkshakes appear and disappear like a magic show!😅

Great place for social distancing.
title: Superb Hotel for social distancing

text: This hotel was the third and final hotel my husband and I stayed at for our honeymoon. It was also a fraction of the price of the other hotels we went to. We really enjoyed our stay here but the service could do with some finetuning. For example when we arrived, concierge was no where to be seen to help us with our bags and the staff here are not as friendly and warm as we found during our stay at other places. Highlights for us include: a seamless check in with a refreshing fresh fruit ice lollies when you arrive, beautiful pool villa with a very big bed, great a la carte breakfast, amazing floating pool breakfasts (make sure you pre book!) great massages, free shuttle to Balangan beach where you can watch surfers ride the waves and great robes (which say "do not disturb i am on vacation!") All in all, a pleasant stay and somewhere I would come again to.

We stayed last year as a birthday treat and were there for 5 nights at the end of our Bali tour. By far and away the most beautiful part of our stay; luxury accommodation with our own pool in this gorgeous and quiet resort. 

Rooms are fabulous: spacious, clean, stylish, well planned and executed. There is everything you could need.

Staff are exceptional. As it was my birthday, they made me a card and set up dinner on a little island above the pool, making me feel really special. We also had the most amazing floating breakfast to start the day. 

I can not recommend this hotel enough. Don’t be put off by the remote location as it’s within walking distance of beautiful beaches and you can hire a car with driver for less than £50 for a full day. The remote location is what makes it so peaceful and tranquil.

text: We visited Bali for the first time.  The staff were amazing, nothing was a problem.  We were treated well.  Very helpful.   It is a beautiful resort but it comes with the price tag.  I often heard that Bali is cheap.  I did not find this being the case for prices in Bali against other Bali comparisons.  However, it is cheap compared to other countries.  Staff absolutely beautiful at the restaurant, but could do with more variety on the menu (problem was we bought the dinner vouchers which were limiting) . Rooms were very clean, made up daily with a nightly turn down service.  Spacious (but best to keep it at 2 people).  Gym area not to the standard we hoped - outdoor and extremely hot with not even a bike or treadmill.  Spa and massage treatments were lovely although $60 a massage is no different to my $65 massage in Sydney. We were moved to another room throughout our stay due to a water leak (one day of heavy rain) and the pool pump was quite loud.  Overall it was lovely.  5 out of 5 for the staff.  4 out of 5 for the place and value itself.
title: A gorgeous getaway but be prepared to spend money here.

text: More than a resort, Bali Breakers does everything in its power to make you feel at home.  Their mantra, 'we treat you as family' is like nothing we have experienced before. Every one of the Breaker's Team does everything  they can to make your stay the best they possibly can. The facilities are first class, the daily food offerings beautiful, the massages we enjoyed, simply sublime, the Villa pools allow you to swim and relax without leaving your own space and the resort gardens, backdropped by an amazing vista of endless forest are stunning. While occupancy levels fluctuated during our stay, the service retained its incredible standard throughout, nothing was ever too much and the team continued to recall our names and treat us as part of their extended family.  We arrived with the intention of doing as little as possible and Bali Breakers allowed us to remain resort bound and enjoy a piece of Bali paradise.  We did venture out on a tour of the nearby Cultural Centre and Kecak Fire Dance which were wonderful, but were then very content to bask in the peace and tranquility that the resort provides. Thank you to every one of the amazing Resort Family for a most relaxing and enjoyable week.  What a perfect way to start 2020.

text:
This resort opened in May 2019 and we decided to try after seeing the good reviews below. It’s in the middle of nowhere and off the beaten path, which thought would be good for a change. 

Definitely was off the beaten path - to get there the route was through ALOT of small back streets with 90% of the road filled with pot holes. Imagine a bumpy roller coaster ride for a good 20min. At this point I’m thinking “man, I hope the resort is good!”

Now onto the resort :
1. Single Room Villa - smaller than depicted in the photo. Felt claustrophobic. Also air con unit wasn’t working properly so the room got warm! We had the room changed eventually. No hair comb provided as part of amenities. Shower water tasted like salty sea water. No dining table of any sort inside the room - so all in-room dining is outside in the heat which wasn’t pleasant during the day. 

2. Service - was hit and miss. Hotel staff WALKED INTO OUR VILLA UNANNOUNCED TWICE. First was when they brought in the welcome fruit platter and second was when the pool boy came to check on the pool in the morning of our last day. This totally is unacceptable. Hotel management was apologetic but nothing beyond that. Staff needs more training on this basic respect for privacy.

3. Accessibility - hard to book gojek or grab due to its location. On property food not great and supremely over priced. Mentioned above - road to/from is like a roller coaster ride through a million pot holes.

4. Food - breakfast was barebones, the worst of all resorts I’ve stayed. In-room food wasn’t great, expensive and they close at 10:30pm. Had to resort to grab food which actually is way better quality and price. 

Overall, a small resort in the middle of nowhere only accessible via small back-alley type of roads with sub-standard food and amenities. Not worth your time or money.
title: Waste of time & money

owner_response.text:
Dear spho44,

We would like to thank you for your stay and really appreciate your valued time sharing your stay experience for us. This is paramount for us in making improvement on every aspect of our services for all our guests who will stay at X2 Bali Breakers. Allow me to provide comment about few areas you have mentioned which also needs to be known as this will also provide overall perspective on what to expect when guests will stay with us.

Our location is in the middle of Balangan areas, a 5 minutes away from the famous Balangan beach, settled and set in this area as a new destination, totally away from the busy life where the main aim is to give total privacy within the resort and in their own private pool villa, supported with our facilities and services (including the F&B, Spa, Cross Fit, dedicated WiFi and great design plus ambiance of the resort itself). The bumpy road to reach our resort is one road from 3 other road access that is available, and google map will direct guests who use the map to the nearest location which the road you had taken. We are working to ensure guests are directed to other better access which slightly further to the road you had taken.

We apologize for the inconvenience you have experienced in the villa where you did not find a dinning table provided inside of the room, but outside, as this is part of our design and we will look into this in future for further improvement when it is mostly required. The not cold AC in your villa has been rectified and looked into and thank you for your feedback.

We have met our team members who went it to your villa who did not introduce themselves when bringing the fruit basket for you and our pool attendant who was about to check the pool water as part of their daily routine. They have been briefed and retrained that they need to introduce themselves prior to entering the villa and when meeting our guests in the villa. We apologize for this inconveniences.

Just for your information, that our breakfast concept is a semi buffet where all items are provided, except the hot dishes that are offered differently every day. The aim is to introduce to our guests different variety every day.In addition to our pricing on the F&B menu, you may notice also from many of our guests who have patronized and commented that our price is very reasonable and still considered valued for money.

Note about Gojek/ GoCar in this area, which is mostly similar to other specific area like in some local areas in Bali, those services are still not allowed and not available in the area. It takes time and hope there will be a better change in the future for those services becoming available. For guests, we do have our local transport to work, with affordable fare overall. 

I hope that your first stay experience will not deter you to return stay and we again thank you for all your great positive feedback for us.

With our warmest regards,
Komang Artana
General Manager

text: The rooms are clean and nice, each Villa has a private pool, though the main pool is much better. The pools are also mildly warm and very comfortable, not freezing cold like the usual pools. The best part is the food. My family received many included meals and cocktails. The food is consistently superb - a good menu to choose from and cooked to perfection. There is a range of great Asian and Western cuisine to choose from.The tuna fish is excellent and so is the lamb from the a la carte menu. The pizzas were surprisingly better (to us) than Milk & Madu which is a popular restaurant we went to in Bali. Everyone needs to try the margarita pizza. To top it off, the people working there are incredibly friendly and helpful. It was such an enjoyable stay at X2, very family is very much looking forward to visiting Bali and staying at X2 again.

My wife and I stayed at X2 Jimbaran at the start of December 2019 for 5 nights and they really welcomed us with open arms, Nothing was too much trouble and they went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one. The on-site restaurant dished up 5 star food and dinner experiences every day/night without fail. We tried nearly everything on on menu and not one bad meal. The best thing about the restaurant was that the head chef always came out of the kitchen every night to get feedback on the food, Offer suggestions on foods to try and he always got it right! 

The on-site spa was super relaxing with all the treatments you could ask for. 
The gardening team do a fantastic job monitoring the mosquito situation by putting measures in place to reduce the mosquito populations around the resort. 

We will be back again!

text:
The incheck was smooth and fast and also that they bring the luggage to the room with an golfcart is nice. 

The staff is friendly but that’s everywhere in Bali.

The villa’ s are very nice with the private swimming pools. 

Bed is comfy only downside is the gap between the mattress and headboard, this causes the pillows to fall in the gap. 

Airco works really good in the room, but in the bathroom there is no airco. So everytime you go to the bathroom you go from cold to hot. If it was an open air bathroom it would have make senses but for an closed bathroom it becomes very hot and not comfortable.

Also they build an space for an suitcase in the bathroom but this only gives space for 1 suitcase and needed to put the second suitcase next to the bed because there was no other space. 

Breakfast is poor, pancakes are so thick you need to take a sip of water to swallow it. 

Eggs are an disaster, they taste ok but everyday we waited at least 15 min to get them. Never waited so long for an egg, so congratulations with the longest time to prepare an egg award. This was every day. Mie goreng taste is good but a lot of mie parts who were to hard to eat. 

For an 5 star hotel the selection of the breakfast is very small and almost every day the same. 

3 types of fruit, a basic salad station, drinks basic, yogurts basic.

Glasses for drinks run out very fast because the staff is not paying enough attention.

This needs to improve fast to compete with other 5 stars hotels.

We ordered roomservice, the waiting time was ok, we had an seafood curry soup which was good but a very small portion. It has the price of an main dish but it’s more an starter. Pizza margharita ok, dough was soppy but taste ok. Crunchy chicken burger ok but not special. 

As said the villa’s are really good and private, but breakfast, food and service need to really approve. 

In an 5 star hotel you want to have an “wow” moment everyday with amazing food, but that’s just not the case.
title: accommodation good, the rest mediocre

text:
The Best Kept Secret is Out! X2 (Cross To ‘a new dimension of luxury’) you have captured my heart and the area here has certainly fed my Soul, I have truely ‘Crossed To’ the other side!

After being amongst the tourist trap I was craving more, and after travelling a short distance from the hustle of tourism, (30-45 minutes) what I found here at X2 is exactly what it was that was missing!
Pure relaxation, privacy, tranquility and Peace mixed with First Class Service and good food and beverage options where although the quantity here far exceed the  quality you find elsewhere in Bali the price mark remains on par (to my surprise!)

What was missing from my Bali adventure I finally found here. Luxurious surrounds that meet the so far untouched Bali countryside and where one of the most beautiful beaches on earth is on your doorstep!  X2 where your best packed outfit that you packed for that special dinner in Bali is perfectly paired with sandy feet and a pair of thongs and a smile.

On arrival I was escorted to my Private Villa, (all X2 accommodation options are Villas with private pools I believe) From the Arrival and reception area a short walk through the garden paths and by 2 of the 3 swimming pools (one is Adults only) the private entrance to my villa was opened to reveal my own oasis of Tranquility.

What awaited us was.. 

- a private courtyard, sitting area with the option of outdoor dining (the room service also is reasonable and won’t break the bank) and can be easily ordered and delivered super quickly.

- A sundeck with 2 comfy beanbags for catching the rays without prying eyes of neighbours (high walls provide total privacy!!)

- A small but adequate, cool but really refreshing plunge pool with water feature that lulls you to another place whist you relax.

- A 4 poster bed with quality linen and the most comfortable bed that had me ‘sleep in’ of the morning for the first time since arriving in Bali. (Too comfy to get out).

- Huge bathroom with abundant amount of natural light with doors to the outside where you can take a shower (with instant hot water ‘a first for me in Bali’) with free flowing amenities that smelled divine and a free standing bath letting the outdoors via the French opening doors. (And of course accompanied by beautiful smelling bath salts.. X2 hasn’t missed a thing).

- A turndown service (we took an evening swim and on arriving back to our room the bed was turned down, pillows fluffed, towels and robes refreshed and slipper put in place, This was such a lovely extra to come back to)

Some things not to miss!...
- Theme dinners that include fantastic live music that had everyone involved at a really reasonable price.

- Exquisite tasting quality cocktails from the ever so friendly bar men who were quick to take your order or to recommend your next choice.

- Breakfast offering ‘At last’ The perfect Cappuccino and where the buffet is small but perfect and super fresh where you can also order A La Carte from the waiters with their smiling faces, helpful service and their smart uniforms.

- Peel yourself from the pools and go to the beach! It will WOW you! Take your Camera! Breathtaking!

- Take a bike and go for a ride (there is no traffic! A small minimart with ATM is only a short ride away!

- Nighttime swims are magical!

Some things missing for X2 however are coming soon I am told, being the fitness centre and the Spa both of which I am looking forward to seeing when the property is complete. X2 is brand new so you will need to be patient for some things but for me everything here was already PERFECT!

Be warned what you WON’T find here however is Tourist en Masse, Noise, Pollution, Crazy nightlife and bars or abundant shops and sellers selling the same old things and most of all traffic!!! (allow the property at least 20 minutes for a taxi or private transport, local motorbikes can also be rented) All of which I certainly did not miss, some also say ‘isolated’ perhaps not everyone’s idea of Bali vacation but the isolation is all part of what makes it so special.. and I’d wouldn’t have it any other way!

A special Thank you to all the wonderful staff including The Manager Mr Komang and Duty Manager Mr Yun who always greeted me by name and laughed at my jokes with his infectious laugh and great smelling cologne :) 
I’d especially like to thank Evan/ Area Manager who recommended this Oasis away from it all, you were right it is Magnificent and is exactly what I was after! There is always a property to perfectly fit a guest and you picked the right one for me! Spot on!
title: A review or photos can’t capture the essence! This place is breathtaking!

text:
Stay in hotels for +125nights/year. A.o. Hilton Diamond, IHG Spire and Bonvoy Platinum member. Constant in search of new hotels / soft openings, addicted to the excitement of reviewing new places. 

Lets start of by saying that X2 Bali Breakers has a lot of potential. But there is a bridge to gap, and am wondering if the group / management will be able to overcome. 

The main downside is the room. Advertised as a 100sqm pool villa, with seating by the pool... well, forget about it. It’s a miniature room, way smaller that shown on pictures, with an unpractical set-up. There’s a small inside with very limited storage. The pool is positioned on the long side of the room (shouldn’t call it a pool, it’s a plunger really), and the seating is positioned on the other side of the room. Very different from the pictures that are shown with this room type. We stayed in hotels and villas advertised as 45-60sqm that are much bigger. So I wonder where the meters went to. Perhaps there are bigger / better rooms; but we were downgraded? 

Then the bathroom is such an annoying space, hideously set-up. Luggage storage next to the toilet, really? Shower with glass housing, flooding everywhere. Sink too low positioned. And the door to the side doesn’t shut down. So it gets terribly warm in the bathroom, and the A/C doesn’t suffice to cool down (by the way, also here on the pictures the AC is not shown... and it just doesn’t look good). I personally hate warm bathrooms in tropical countries. 

So, all in all it’s not a optimal room. Reiterated by the misleading pictures, and descriptions, the initial thought is disappointment. This has been addressed also by other guest in the reviews, we now realize. 

Some other flaws, which are not on par with the 5 star grade / price:

- No bell service. Arrived 20.30 in the night. No one to help with the bags... next day we realized there is so much staff walking around, perhaps let one do the bell service?
- Breakfast is made to order (a la carte), but items are sold out... that makes no sense. 
- Coffee came luke-warm (?)
- both plates and mats on the tables had stains. Was addressed and resolved, but being so obvious this can be prevented. It gives a bad impression about hygiene... whilst I do think this property has no hygiene issues at all. 
- Spa booking only 1 day in advance
- Fitness area not yet finished
- Tailored mini-bar... no way. Doesn’t work. Have to call for your items, and then exit the room, garden and open the door the pick it up. This is even worse than room-service, again due to lay-out of the room. 

What I think definitely works:

- General pool areas are amazing. The hotel is not fully finished / occupied, but has plenty of capacity by the pool. 
- It’s located in a quiet areas, remote and calm
- Local cuisine is absolutely top-notch. Tried the nasi campur which is one of the best on the island. Price is very low (85k-), but tiny portion. It’s ok. Pool day snacks are good (tried the tacos and pizza, well done). Rendang is too die for!
- Amenities provides for children are very complete and good. Well done!
- Construction (or maintenance) noise spoils a bit the serene environment. But then again, it is soft opening...

So all in all, plenty of opportunity to improve. The rooms will never compare the other villas and resorts in Bali where you get more value for money, it’s wise to advertise more appropriate to prevent disappointment. But enough to build on, and will eventually work. Cheers.
title: Just not good enough (yet?)

text: We visited X2, Cross To, as it is actually pronounced, in order to have some relaxing days in Bali. What we finally experienced, was more than we expected. The resort is really nice, with beautiful gardens and the villas are extremely cosy with a lot of privacy. Each villa has its own, private pool making your stay romantic and quiet. Even when the resort was fully booked, in the main pool area there was almost no one. Besides the premises now, the staff was amazing, very kind, polite, always with a smile and willing to help.To give an example, during our stay, my wife got sick and the support we had was fantastic. Not only this, but every one from the staff was asking how is she going and wishing to get well soon. Thanks to them, we felt like home. Last, but not least, the food, which was delicious both in the breakfast and the a la carte menu. I recommend this resort for an unforgettable stay in Bali. Tip: Don’t forget to enjoy a really nice massage at the spa.

text:
I usually don't write reviews, no matter if I found the hotel very good or bad.
Exceptions confirm the rule; either when the hotel was really bad or exceeded my expectations by far - like the X2.

The villas themselves are as beautiful as described, beautiful furnishings, great and comfortable bed and simply very well designed... And then the pool,  perfect.

Breakfast and food is excellent, especially the a la carte service at breakfast.

But I have rarely experienced such an outstanding service. Yes, in Indonesia there are many hotels and restaurants with good service, but by outstanding I really mean that the team here just really likes to be super courteous and doing everything to make the guests super happy. My wife was also ill on vacation, and what the staff here have all supported - a long story in short: my expectations of service & support were far exceeded.

Berry, the General Manager (Dutchman) has everything under control here (thanks for all) and I can't emphasize any of the employees because they are all great ;-)

PS:
One more thing is to emphasize - the cleanliness is absolutely great, many 5 star chain hotels can cut themselves a thick slice of it...

text:
We arrived at X2 wanting to relax a bit in the middle of our vacation and got everything we could have wished for, with our own beautiful private pool, spacious villas, especially the bathroom is larger than average, and all the facilities that we could need. There is also a café 200 meters down the road if you'd like to mix up your facilities a little. 

There is also a shuttle going to the beach if you'd like to surf or just have a beach-side stay. 

Pros: 
* Large, spacious villas with private pools
* Excellent breakfast and restaurant, with very good meals
* Beautiful resort area
* Very friendly staff

Cons
* Might consider changing the music by the pool a little :)

It should be noted, that when we stayed, as far as we could tell the spa and gym was not yet opened, so if that is a key factor for you, check whether these are opened yet.
title: A calm, relaxing stay in Bali

text:
I stayed here from May 28 - 31 2019 and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The resort has a laid back, but luxurious feel. 

All the staff were welcoming, warm, and very accommodating. I genuinely enjoyed chatting with them specifically the driver, the front desk person and server (I wish I remember their names- their contribution and genuine passion for their job is what makes this resort exceptional)

I also appreciated the breakfast and dinner menu. So much so that I ended up having dinner here every night. My two favorites were: the seafood soup and tuna filet dish. The cocktails were also refreshing. 

The villas are nice and have everything you’d need for a relaxing stay. The turn down service was appreciated especially after a long day of exploring.

The resort provides a shuttle to and from Balangan beach. I went to the beach right after checking in and watched a terrific sunset. They also provide bikes for guests; great for morning rides when the weather is still on the cooler side.

Since the resort is new, the only challenge was that taxi drivers don’t know where it is. Thankfully, it’s already on google maps. 

Overall, great resort and would recommend to anyone looking for a laid back environment away from the hustle and bustle of Kuta or Seminyak.
title: Great staff makes for an exceptional resort

text:
Wir waren für vier Nächte im Cross Bali Breakers und waren absolut begeistert.
Die Zimmer waren sauber und stilvoll eingerichtet, das beste war allerdings der gut temperierte Pool, einfach toll....
Ein zusätzliches Highlight war jeden Abend der Turndownservice.
Zum Personal bleibt zu sagen, dass ich solch eine Freundlichkeit noch nicht erlebt habe, absolut alle waren sehr höflich und zuvorkommend. Besonders hervor stachen jedoch Hendrik und Tuyen, an die beiden möchte ich noch ein großes Dankeschön aussprechen, ihr habt unseren Aufenthalt noch ein bisschen schöner gemacht.
Hendrik hat sich um alles gekümmert, unter anderem die Fahrt zur Apotheke, zum Strand, da unsere Abholung zu einem gebuchten Ausflug und auch die zum Flughafen unklar war, hat er sich auch darum gekümmert. Im Prinzip konnten wir den Kopf ausschalten und einfach genießen! 
Ein absolutes Highlight war das floating Breakfast, normalerweise findet dieses im Zimmer statt, da wir aber sechs Personen (Familie) waren, konnten wir dieses im Poll an der Lobby erleben. Es war soooo lecker und absolut einzigartig.

Alles in allem war es ganz toll, vielen Dank.
title: tolles Hotel im grünen

text:
L’Hôtel est récent (2019), très calme et agréable pour se reposer en plein milieu de la nature. 
Il y a une piscine centrale avec un pool-bar et le restaurant à côté. Pina colada bonne et mojito moyens. Le restaurant est assez bon, toutefois un peu cher comparé à la quantité. 
Les villas avec piscines privées sont spacieuses et très confortables (lit et oreillers confortables, douche et baignoire, sèche cheveux, coffre fort, peignoirs, etc…). 
Contrairement à d’autres commentaires, le petit déjeuner inclus est très correct avec un buffet (céréales, riz, plats Indo, fromage, fruit, bacon, lait, jus, viennoiseries) ainsi que 3 plats à la carte différents chaque matin (smoothie, crêpe, avocado toast, quiche, etc). 
Le personnel est très gentil et serviable. 
L’hôtel propose un service de navettes gratuits pour se rendre jusqu’à Balang Beach, jolie plage en contre bas pour voir les surfeurs et le coucher de soleil. Les horaires des navettes pourraient être plus rapprochées car parfois 3h d’attente entre le drop-off et le pick-up. 
4 étoiles car les prestations sont excellentes mais il manque ce petit quelque chose d’un hôtel 5 étoiles. Le rapport qualité/prix est quand même très très bon et C’est un hôtel que je referai avec plaisir.
title: Calme, confortable et agréable

text: Eine Sehr schöne und gepflegte Anlage. Es sind Villas mit einem eigenen Pool vorhanden. Es gibt zudem 3 pools (ich habe nicht wirklich verstanden warum so viele....) aber der Hauptpool mit einer Wasserbar ausreichend Liegemöglichkeiten und einem sehr guten Angebot an Getränken und Speisen. Die Preise sind für ein Hotel Ok, für Bali Verhältnisse im oberen Bereich (1 Bier ca. 3€ umgerechnet) Die Zimmer sind sehr angenehm mit Klimaanlage und einer Badewanne mit Wasserdüsen (Mini Yakutzi) ausgestattet. Minibar vorhanden (aber leer, ideal für Getränke aus dem Supermarkt ca. 2 KM entfernt) Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und Hilfsbereit, versucht alle Wünsche zu erfüllen. Es gibt einen kostenlosen Shuttleservice zum Beach, der ist ideal für Wellenreiten und Surfen (wer es kann und mag...) Am Strand gibt es einige Beach Clubs, wo man gut und (für Europäische Verhältnisse) essen und trinken kann. Für einen Indonesier unerschwinglich.... Eine komplette Mahlzeit für 2 Personen mit Getränken inklusive Tip ca. 30€) Das Frühstück ist sehr gut, es gibt eine Speisekarte aus der verschiedene Speisen ausgewählt werden können. Sehr toll ist das "Floating Break fast" im eigenen Pool..... wirklich mal was anderes! Eine Besonderheit ist eine "Kapelle" auf dem Gelände dort kann auch geheiratet werden, oder große Feierlichkeiten statt finden. Nach 2 Jahren Lockdown sind die Mitarbeiter sehr erfreut jeden Gast zu begrüßen. Es ist sowieso ein Land des Lächelns aber ich habe das Gefühl nach dem Lockdown noch ein bisschen mehr! Die Preise für ein Abendessen im Hotel sind angemessen, die Speisen sehr gut zubereitet und alle Zutaten sind frisch. Wenn Ihr Yoga trefft (der ist im Poolbarbereich und bringt euch das Floating Breakfast) der ist sehr zuvorkommend und sehr hilfsbereit ! Room Service Top, Pool Top, Service im Hotel insgesamt Top, Preise OK , Anlage insgesamt Top, Zimmer Top...... Verdiente 5 Sterne ! Einziges Manko, die Wassersprinkler im Pool lassen sich nicht ausstellen, das ist auf die Dauer, besonders Nachts, sehr laut und stört ein wenig, so das man lieber an den Pool ausweicht. Es gibt in der Umgebung noch 2 kleine Restaurants (die auch zum Hotel gehören) Der SPA Bereich ist sehr empfehelenswert, die Mitarbeiter sehr freundlich und machen einen tollen Job. Die Preise sind wirklich sehr fair und für Deutsche Verhältnisse ein Spotpreis für diese Leistung ! Das Publikum ist International, alles sehr angenehme Gäste .... KLARE EMPFEHLUNG
title: Superschön

text:
Die relativ kleine Anlage liegt relativ abgelegen und ruhig (die kleinen Straßen sind recht abenteuerlich) - quasi mitten auf dem Land. Fahrtzeit zum Flughafen ca. 30 Min.
Das Motto der X2-Gruppe "Luxus durch Design" hat sich sichtbar niedergeschlagen: Modernes, geschmackvolles Ambiente, großzügiges Zimmer und Bad, kleiner Innenhof mit eigenem Pool, kurze Wege, schöner Poolbereich.
Der Service ließ keine Wünsche offen: Kleine Probleme wurden sofort behoben, die Mitarbeitenden durchweg sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit (typisch balinesisch?).
Die  Küche bietet eine gute Abwechslung: Pizza und Burger, aber auch typisch indonesische Gerichte - alles sehr schmackhaft. Sehr guter Cappucino, Cocktailauswahl nicht sehr groß, aber die Standards sind vorhanden.
Wir haben nur einmal den Shuttle zum Strand genutzt. Denn dieser war eine ziemliche Enttäuschung: Viel Müll (typisch in der Regenzeit), und alles ziemlich heruntergekommen.
Insgesamt ist die Anlage sehr gut, um runterzukommen und einen Zwischenstopp einzulegen.
Einziger Nachteil: Wenn man nach Bali fährt, will man was von der Insel sehen. Dafür ist die Lage dann doch eben einfach sehr abgeschieden. Nach Ubud fährt man z.B. 2 Stunden.
title: Entspannung pur!

text:
Séjour de 12 nuits sur place . 

Cet hôtel est juste un paradis ! Situé en quelque sorte dans la forêt , cela rend l’endroit déjà atypique . 

Le service est parfait, le staff qui y travaille est toujours souriant , quelque soit les conditions . Service impeccable également . 

Nous avions eu un accident de scooter sur place ( le Classic ) , que dire de l’hospitalité ( très bonne en général à Bali ) , ils nous ont aidé dans toutes circonstances . 

La nourriture bien que pas forcément très très varie , est très suffisante à soit même et est vraiment délicieuse . En effet des petites soirées à thèmes culinaires sont organisés très fréquemment dans la semaine , afin de variés le types de cuisines . 

Bref, voyage qui a été au top malgré les séquelles et l’handicap subit au voyage , l’hôtel et son staff nous ont fait oubliés nos pépins . 

Je le recommande fortement , n’hésitez pas , vous êtes au bon endroit !!! 

Cordialement 

Encore un grand merci pour votre sourire  et votre hospitalité !!

入住後完全沒失望，check in時立刻送上好吃的冰棒，而當天剛好是我的生日，一進房飯店人員又馬上準備了生日驚喜，當晚我們在飯店內吃的晚餐，價格和料理亦都令人滿意。隔天的早餐，除了優格，水果，飲料，生菜自助區，其他無限次數單點的早餐料理，也道道美味。
除了飯店的軟硬體不錯，這裡的住客不多，更提升了住宿品質，餐廳和公共的3座泳池都不會像鬧區大型飯店那樣擁擠，唯一的不方便大概就是地處偏遠，但有包車的話真的不是問題，車程不遠就有超市，飯店也有車載住客到附近的Balangan Beach遊玩。
如果是單純想放鬆渡假，不愛逛街購物，這裡真的是一個寧靜舒適的好選擇。
title: 值得推薦的渡假天堂

text:
L'EXCELLENCE ! Nous y étions à l'occasion de notre lune de miel , nous y avons passer un séjour INOUBLIABLE. 
Le cadre & le design de cet hôtel sont majestueux. 
L'équipe du Bali Breakers Resort a était aux nos petits soins , le professionnalisme de chacun nous a ÉPOUSTOUFLER. A travers chacun d'entre eux, nous avons pu entrevoir et comprendre ce que c'est que la culture balinaise. ( Chaleureux , convivial , souriant ,serviable , amicale ) Si notre séjour a était si beaux , c'est grâce a ce staff incroyable qui a tout fait pour que cela le soit.
Le restaurant Point Break nous a CONQUIS  par ces repas locaux revisité et de QUALITÉ . Pour avoir eu la chance de rencontrer et de discuter avec le Chef de cuisine , Son savoir faire , son expérience et sa maitrise culinaires  de haut standing ajoute un atout de poids a ce magnifique complexe hôtelier . De différents buffet copieux et de différent type sont organisés le soir au bord de l'une des 3 piscine de l'hôtel accompagnée de chanteurs reprenant les plus grands tubes internationaux actuel ou plus anciens . Voici un hôtel 5  étoiles qui rafale de loin les plus beaux palaces parisien, la ou on peut y être snober et mépriser . Le corps entier de l'hôtel était a notre disposition et nous traiter avec énormément de respect , d'amitié et de joie , vertus et compétences que l'on ne retrouve plus avec le temps dans le complexe prestigieux de renom . Je pourrais dire énormément encore sur notre séjour au X2 Bali Breakers Ressort hôtel mais je vous recommande vivement d'y aller et de faire cet magnifique expérience de vous même , Vous ne serez pas déçu.  
 Nous tenIons a Remercier très Particulièrement : Raymondo , Sari , Agus & Farah ainsi que tout le staff du Bali breakers pour ce séjour inoubliable. Ne vous poser aucune question allez-y, un séjour merveilleux vous y attends.
title: LA PERFECTION !!!!

text:
Premier voyage à Bali via ventes privées : 10 jours sur place 

Dès l arrivée: étonnement surpris par le standing de l hôtel planté en pleine campagne. ( 25 min en voiture du centre ville de Jimbaran car circulation dense) . Personnel très accueillant :  glace fruitée artisanale proposée à l arrivée très appréciable 
-Hôtel assez intimiste, calme et loin de l agitation de la ville. Décoration style indonésien , sobre avec des belles pièces locales ( lustres  , bois noble) 

-Villa individuelle avec piscine privative  et terrasse. 
Climatisation et ventilateur très appréciable  Étonnement surpris car quasi  absence de moustique au vu de la végétation environnante. 
Vrai lit double king  size ( un seul matelas ) très confortable 
 Douche à l italienne + baignoire 

-Restauration: demi pension . Nous prenions le petit déjeuner et le dîner à l hôtel 
Cuisine de très grande qualité : assaisonnement , fraîcheur des produits et présentation . Majorité de plats locaux généreusement servis.
Serveurs très efficaces 
petite mention pour le spinach smoothie bowl du petit déjeuner exceptionnel 

Services : 
Possibilité de louer des vélos gratuitement  et scooter à la journée pour 75 000 roupies ( prêt de casques)
Possibilité de se faire apporter un petit déjeuner sur panier flottant dans la piscine de la villa pour 300 000 roupies.

Sorties à faire: l’hôtel est situé à 10 min en scooter de Balangan beach, à 25 min de Jimbaran, à 20 min du parc culturel, à 35 min de Uluwatu.
Pour le reste des sorties, nous avons commandé un chauffeur privé.

En bref, hôtel idyllique, nous recommandons à 100%
title: Séjour de rêve en amoureux

Nous avons séjourné 4 nuits dans cet hôtel. L’hôtel a quelques mois, la décoration est à tomber par terre. C’est sublime. Les espaces communs sont tops. Les piscines sont très agréables. 
Le Spa n’est pas encore terminé mais les services sont assurés dans une villa. Notre massage était merveilleux, je recommande vivement. 
Le restaurant est succulent, la carte des petits déjeuners varient chaque matin. Un léger bémol sur les jus de fruits du petit déjeuner qui ne sont pas frais, c’est regrettable. Les cocktails et jus à la carte le sont toutefois. Et ils sont divins.
Le personnel est aux petits soins, attentionné et très souriant. 
La chambre est très belle, décoration contemporaine. Notre baignoire bulle ne fonctionnait pas, notre frigo non plus ... c’est dommage. 
La piscine privée n’était pas très chaude, un peu trop enclavée entre les murs ... mais là je chipote !
L’hôtel est excentré, il faut une bonne demie heure de voiture pour aller à Jimbaran.  
Très bel endroit !
title: Superbe hôtel

Il y a une navette gratuite pour Balangan beach, à faire. Cependant il est recommandé de louer un scooter ou de faire appel a un taxi car peu de choses aux alentours hormis un bar bien sympathique juste à l entrée de la rue. Excellente adresse
